meanings.definition: The shadow or darkness cast by an object blocking light.
meanings.sent1: The umbril of the tree provided relief from the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: She sat in the umbril of the building, enjoying the cool breeze.
meanings.sent3: The umbril of the umbrella made the picnic more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the umbril of darkness enveloped the town.
meanings.sent5: The umbril of the mountain loomed over the valley, creating a sense of mystery.

meanings.sent1: The garden had a peaceful umbril where one could relax.
meanings.sent2: The umbril of the forest provided a perfect spot for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The umbril of the park was a favorite spot for the locals to gather.
meanings.sent4: She found solace in the umbril of her favorite reading nook.
meanings.sent5: The umbril of the cave offered a cool escape from the heat outside.

meanings.sent1: He quickly moved to umbril her from the harsh sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The tree umbriled the delicate flowers from the scorching heat.
meanings.sent3: The kind stranger umbriled the lost puppy until its owner was found.
meanings.sent4: The large umbrella umbriled the entire table from the rain.
meanings.sent5: She always umbriled her friends with a comforting presence during tough times.
